H0.text: 0.15 m/s² is the average rate of acceleration of the train that travels at 13 m/s and increases its speed to 22 m/s over the next 60 seconds.

H1.text: 0.21 m/s² is the average rate of acceleration of a train that travels at 13 m/s and increases its speed to 22 m/s over the next 60 seconds.

H2.text: 0.36 m/s² is the average rate of acceleration of the train that travels at 13 m/s and increases to 22 m/s over 60 seconds.

H3.text: 0.58 m/s² is the average rate of acceleration of a train that starts at 13 m/s and increases its speed to 22 m/s over 60 seconds.

A4.text: a = d v / d t = lim Δt→0 (v(t+Δt)-v(t))/Δt.

A5.text: Consequently, the acceleration is the second derivative of position, often written d²s/dt².
